snippet: A party known as Ataka, which means attack, champions “Bulgaria for Bulgarians” and has denounced Syrian refugees as terrorists whom Bulgaria, the European Union’s poorest nation, must expel.
abstract: Resurgence of far-right Ataka Party in Bulgaria illustrates how influx of Syrian refugees is fueling momentum of populist, anti-immigrant movements across Eastern Europe; group has used relatively small number of refugees to stoke fears and improve their fortunes in the European Union's poorest country.
lead_paragraph: A party known as Ataka, which means attack, champions “Bulgaria for Bulgarians” and has denounced Syrian refugees as terrorists whom Bulgaria, the European Union’s poorest nation, must expel.

headline.main: Far Right in Eastern Europe Makes Gains as Syrians Arrive
headline.print_headline: Far Right Gains as Syrians Reach Eastern Europe

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
